title.narrative: Accreditation of new EQuIP policy (co-)facilitators and revision of the EQuIP toolkit

description.narrative:
This concept note answers a request from GIZ received on 19 August 2020 for submitting a proposal to train new “Enhancing the Quality of Industrial Policies” (EQuIP) facilitators and to revamp the EQuIP toolkit. It followed from a discussion initiated in spring 2019.
This project implements the training and accreditation of new facilitators, as well as a revision of the toolkit’s content. Thereby, it responds to a growing demand for experts able to deploy these tools, while reflecting lessons learned over the past five years since the inception of the original tools. In addition, the project purports to add practical considerations on how to integrate evidence into the policymaking process.
A particular emphasis is to be put on ensuring that the private sector is engaged in the policymaking process. Experts will be trained to understand the crucial role of the private sector in developing industrial policies and the EQuIP revision will be done in a way that it sets out ways to engage the private sector in the industrial policy development and evaluation process...
